frameDefinitions: A Submittor gives Documents to an Authority so that they can be processed as part of an application, evaluation or other official or bureaucratic process.
Two or more distinct entities, which may be concrete or abstract objects or types, are characterized as being similar to each other.
Words in this frame have to do with a Cognizer being aware (or not being aware) of the difference between two Phenomena, which may be expressed jointly or disjointly.
An Entity changes, either in its category membership, its situation, or in terms of the quality of an Attribute.
LUs in this frame describe a non-commutative statement of arithmetic, e.g. subtraction and division, involving two numbers, labeled Term_1 and Term_2.
A Current_instance of a certain Type is under discussion.
frameExamples: I  was sure I had passed as soon as I <t>handed</t> <t>in</t> the test. DNI

A mulberry is very <t>similar</t> in shape
to a loganberry
It is very difficult for people to visually <t>distinguish</t> between living and non-living things from such a great distance .
As soon as Tiffany kissed the frog, Tiffany <t>turned</t> into a frog.
Kim has a <t>different</t> hair color every week
listRoleDefinitions: The person that begins in possession of the <fen>Documents</fen> and gives them over into the possession of the <fen>Authority</fen> for processing.
The individual or organization that ends up in possession of the <fen>Documents</fen> and processes them.
The artifacts containing content, typically in the form of text and images, that the Submittor gives to the <fen>Authority</fen>.
The time period during which the <fen>Submittor</fen> gives the <fen>Documents</fen> to the <fen>Authority</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Submittor</fen> gives the <fen>Documents</fen> to the <fen>Authority</fen>.
This role marks constituents that express the set of objects or types whose similarity is at issue.

When there is an asymmetry, <fen>Entity_1</fen> is the entity characterized by its similarity to <fen>Entity_2</fen>, whose characteristics are assumed to be known.  <fen>Entity_1</fen> is often an external argument.

When the <fen>Entities</fen> are expressed separately, <fen>Entity_2</fen> is the one whose characteristics are assumed to be known; it serves as a basis for establishing characteristics of <fen>Entity_1</fen>.
This role marks constituents which express a property in respect to which the similarity of the entities is assessed.
A fact about <fen>Entity_1</fen> or the <fen>Entities</fen> that reveals how <fen>Entity_1</fen> is the same or different from other entities.  (Note the contrast with 'as to'.)
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the similarity occurs or exists.
The Place is the general area in which similarity occurs or exists
The cognizer is the person (or other sentient being) who potentially determines that two Phenomena are distinct from each other. It is normally expressed as an External Argument:

The phenomena that are potentially judged to be different from one another can be expressed as separate constituents. When they are, one is typically expressed as an NP Object, and the other as a PP Complement headed by <ment>from</ment>:
See Phenomenon_1, above. The phenomenon expressed less prominently as a PP complement is called <fen>Phenomenon_2</fen>:
Both phenomena that are potentially judged to be different from one another can be expressed jointly by the same constituent:

This is a property that is potentially used by the Cognizer to distinguish one phenomenon from another. It is normally expressed as a PP headed by a preposition such as <ment>from</ment>, <ment>by</ment>, or <ment>on the basis of</ment>:
The concrete or abstract entity that undergoes a change.
The type of <fen>Entity</fen> that results from the change.
The category that the <fen>Entity</fen> belongs to before it undergoes the change.
The value of the <fen>Attribute</fen> before the change takes place.
The quality of the <fen>Attribute</fen> that results from the change.
A characteristic of the <fen>Entity</fen> for which a quality can be assigned or determined by calculation, measurement, or observation.

The <fen>Initial_value</fen> and <fen>Final_value</fen> taken together as the range through which the <fen>Entity</fen> changes.

The main faith of the church has <t>changed</t> <fex name='val'>between Orthodox, Protestant and Greek Catholic</fex> several times.
The <fen>Entity</fen>'s situation that results from the change.
The situation that the <fen>Entity</fen> began in.
The time at which the <fen>Entity</fen> undergoes the transformation.
The location that the change takes place.
<fen>Term_1</fen> is the first operand in the non-commutative arithmetic that is modified by <fen>Term_2</fen> (e.g. subtracted by or divided by <fen>Term_2</fen>).
<fen>Term_2</fen> is the second operand of the non-commutative arithmetic which modifies <fen>Term_1</fen> (e.g. subtracts from or divides <fen>Term_1</fen>).
The <fen>Result</fen> of the non-commutative process combining <fen>Term_1</fen> and <fen>Term_2</fen>.
The kind of thing of which instances are under discussion.
The instance of the <fen>Type</fen> that is currently under discussion.
An instance of the <fen>Type</fen> that was encountered previously and which is now compared for identity with the <fen>Current_instance</fen>.
The situation in which another instance of the <fen>Type</fen> was encountered earlier.
The complete set of instances of the <fen>Type</fen> involved in the mentioned contexts.
The Time when the Current_instance is the same or different.
listRoleExamples: The Human Services financial worker cannot decide if you will get food support benefits until <fex>you</fex> turn in the form and needed verifications.
If an application is late, whether you submitted it late <fex>to us</fex> or it was held up at your Command, NMETC will not be able to fund registration fees.

Once you have submitted <fex>the form</fex>, a request to make an oral statement will be
generated based on the information you supplied.
<fex>The two painters</fex> were alike in being unable to draw acceptably .
In the first phase <fex>Barthes's approach</fex> has similarities to that of Levi-Strauss.
The results of Method 2 show remarkable similarity <fex>to those obtained by Method 1</fex>
The disc announced Friday is <fex>physically</fex> similar to current music CDs
His presidency was different <fex>in that it offered a way forward for the common man</fex> .
<fex>The teacher</fex> couldn't distinguish one child from the other.
The teacher couldn't distinguish Pat from Kim.
The teacher couldn't distinguish Pat <fex>from Kim</fex>.
The teacher couldn't distinguish <fex>the twins</fex>.
The coach could distinguish the twins <fex>by their hair</fex>.
How pleasing to see that <fex>Martha</fex> has changed now.
The viccar changed <fex>from a professional clergyman</fex> into an anti-ecclesiastical activist.
At that time, my asthma changed <fex>from very mild</fex> to severe.
Its color changed from red <fex>to blue</fex>.
Test to check if <fex>the color</fex> changes when you place your mouse over the JavaScript image
Tests went from taking three hours <fex>to needing less than one</fex> .
She slowly shifted <fex>from giving him makework</fex> to actually finding he had some skills .
<fex>Then</fex> she turned into a lizard.
Smithers works in a different <fex>office</fex> now
This is a different car <fex>than last week</fex>
Kent Clark and Superman are the same person
